modelIdentification.name: SISO Space FOM Core
modelIdentification.description: Definitions of common, low level HLA settings and data types.

timeStamp.semantics: Microseconds since the beginning of the federation execution.

simpleData.name: MassRate
simpleData.semantics: A mesaurement of the rate of change of mass.

simpleData.name: MassMomentOfInertia
simpleData.semantics: A scalar moment or coefficient of inertia. There are nine such scalars in a moment of inertia matrix.

simpleData.name: TemperatureRate
simpleData.semantics: A measure of the time rate of change of temperature.

arrayData.name: PositionVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the translational position of one point with respect to another. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: VelocityVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of the vector position of some point with repect to another as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: AccelerationVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of a vector velocity of some point with respect to another as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: AngularVelocityVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the orientation of one reference frame with respect to another. This data type does not specify the reference frames, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: AngularAccelerationVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the time derivative of an angular velocity vector as seen by an observer fixed in some reference frame. This data type does not specify which angular velocity, nor does it specify the observer frame of reference, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: InertiaMatrix
arrayData.semantics: A 3x3 matrix that specifies the mass inertia matrix of a body about some coordinate axes. The nine elements of the matrix are stored row-wise, namely: Ixx, Ixy, Ixz, Iyx, Iyy, Iyz, Izx, Izy, Izz. The off-diagonal components Iij (i!=j) are the so-called 'negative integrals'. This means that the elements in this inertia matrix satify the equation H=Iw. Where H is the angular momentum vector, I is the inertia matrix and w is the angular velocity vector. This data type does not specify the coordinate axes about which the moments are calculated.

arrayData.name: Matrix
arrayData.semantics: A unitless 3x3 matrix. The nine elements of the matrix are stored row-wise, namely: m11, m12, m13, m21, m22, m23, m31, m32, m33, where the first index is the row index.

arrayData.name: ForceVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the vector force. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

arrayData.name: TorqueVector
arrayData.semantics: A 3-vector that specifies the vector torque. This data type does not specify which points are involved, nor does it specify the coordinate axes onto which the three components of the vector are projected.

fixedRecordData.name: ReferenceFrameTranslation
fixedRecordData.semantics: The translational state of a subject reference frame with respect to a 'referent' frame. This data type does not specify the two reference frames.

field.name: position
field.semantics: Position of the subject frame origin with respect to the referent origin with components resolved onto the subject coordinate axes.

field.name: velocity
field.semantics: Velocity of the subject frame origin with respect to its referent origin with components resolved onto the subject coordinate axes.

fixedRecordData.name: ReferenceFrameRotation
fixedRecordData.semantics: The rotational state of a reference frame with respect to a 'referent' frame.

field.name: attitude_quaternion
field.semantics: Attitude quaternion that specfies the orientation of the subject frame with respect to the referent.

field.name: angular_velocity
field.semantics: Angular velocity of the subject frame with respect to the referent with components resolved onto the subject coordinate axes.

fixedRecordData.name: AttitudeQuaternion
fixedRecordData.semantics: A quaternion quantifying the orientation of a 'subject' reference frame with respect to some other 'referent' frame. Quaternions consist one scalar component and a 3-element vector component and can be denoted Q = (s, V) where s is a scalar and V is a vector (x, y, z). Confusion often arises regarding the meaning of the quaternion. (There are several similar but incompatible conventions.) This data type defines a so-called 'left unit transformation quaternion'. It may be used to transform the elements of a vector V_R = (xR, yR, zR) resolved in the referent frame's coordinate axes into the corresponding elements of a vector V_S = (xS, yS, zS) resolved in the subject frame's coordinate axes (ie, determine the components of the same vector in another coordinate system). The quaternion transformation formula is (0, V_A) = Q . (0, V_B) . Q*, where '.' denotes quaternion multiplication and * denotes quaternion conjugation. The formula for multiplation of the quaternion Q1 = (s1, V1) where V1 is the vector (x1, y1, z1) by the quaternion Q2 = (s2, V2) where V2 is the vector (x2, y2, z2) is Q3 = Q1 . Q2 = (s3, V3) where s3 = s1 s2 - (x1 x2 + y1 y2 + z1 z2) and V3 = (x3, y3, z3) with x3 = s1 x2 + s2 x1 + (y1 z2 - z1 y2), y3 = s1 y2 + s2 y1 + (z1 x2 - x1 z2) and z3 = s1 z2 + s2 z1 + (x1 y2 - y1 x2). The formula for conjugation of the quaternion Q = (s, V), where V is the vector (x, y, z) is Q* = (s, -V) = (s, (-x, -y, -z)).

field.name: scalar
field.semantics: The scalar component of the quaternion.

field.name: vector
field.semantics: The vector component of the quaternion.
